intro: Loudonia behrii, commonly known as the Cape primrose, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that come in shades of red, pink, and white. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are square and somewhat hairy. Loudonia behrii thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for garden cultivation.
